Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AS-18W (synthetic AMPs, AS-18 analog, Lys-rich; XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (94.44%) toAS-18obtained by R to W substitution in AS-18. K: 39%; F: 17%.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 25922 or 4 clinical strains (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 or 4 clinical strrains (MIC 16-32 ug/ml),  K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC 16-64 ug/ml), A. baumannii (MIC 8 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC 16 ug/ml), MRSA (MIC 64 ug/ml), S.epidermidis (MIC 128 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC 64 ug/ml) ATCC 10231 >128 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Zhang M, Wang J, Li C, Wu S, Liu W, Zhou C, Ma L.2024
Literature Information.Title: Cathelicidin AS-12W Derived from the Alligator sinensis and Its Antimicrobial Activity Against Drug-Resistant Gram-Negative Bacteria In Vitro and In Vivo.
